era.title: Era
era.description: A boolean flag that sets the event_timeline as an Era, which are used to label a span of time on the timeline navigation. Eras only support the content.dates and content.text fields.

dates.title: Dates
dates.description: An object that holds values relating to the dates within the event.

date_time.title: Date and Time
date_time.description: A string that represents the date and time of the event. Determines the event's placement on the timeline Uses the ISO-8601 (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss) date format except that the year value may exceed four digits when using cosmological scale. (When rendering, should be split and each value should be put into their corresponding fields in the timeline.js format)

display_date.title: Display Date
display_date.description: An optional string that overrides the default date formatting in the timeline navigation.

date_time.title: Date and Time
date_time.description: A string that represents the date and time of the event. Uses the ISO-8601 (yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss) date format except that the year value may exceed four digits when using cosmological scale. (When rendering, should be split and each value should be put into their corresponding fields in the timeline.js format)

display_date.title: Display Date
display_date.description: An optional string that overrides the default date formatting in the timeline navigation.

display_date.title: Display Date
display_date.description: An optional string that overrides all default date formatting in the timeline navigation.

group.title: Group
group.description: An optional string that allows multiple events with the same value to be grouped together on the timeline navigation.

autolink.title: Autolink
autolink.description: A boolean flag that automatically links any URLs and email addresses.

content.title: Content
content.description: The html content for describing the event. This will likely take up the bulk of the space in the events display.

media.title: Event Media
media.description: Optional media that can be associated with the event.

url.title: URL
url.description: A URL to display in the timeline slide. For a list of supported media types, see https://timeline.knightlab.com/docs/media-types.html. Currently, the iframe and blockquote media objects are not supported.

thumbnail.title: Thumbnail
thumbnail.description: An image URL used as the icon for the event in the timeline. If omitted, Timeline will use an icon based on the media type. Not relevant for title slides because they do not have a marker.

title.title: Title
title.description: For image media types, a title for the image. If none is provided, the caption, if any, will be used.

alt.title: Alternate Text
alt.description: For image media types, a short textual description of the image. Required for 508 compliance.

link.title: External Link
link.description: Optional URL to use as the href for wrapping the media with an <a> tag.

link_target.title: Link Target
link_target.description: Optional target to be associated with the media link.

caption.title: Caption
caption.description: A brief text to accompany the media.

credit.title: Credit
credit.description: The source attribution of the media.

background.title: Background Display
background.description: An optional image and color that can be provided to the event's background.

url.title: Image URL
url.description: The URL for the event's background image.

color.title: Color
color.description: A CSS color in hexadecimal or a valid CSS color keyword.
